comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: The Sydney Morning Herald from Monday 31 August 1931 reported that Mrs. J. J. C. Bradfield had provided 20 tree ferns from the North Coast , plus other trees and shrubs, were planted in a Grotto Garden at a dead-end near McDougall Street, North Sydney. It was made the occasion of a party. Mrs. Bradfield placed the first tree fern in position. Dr. Bradfield planted a Moreton Bay ash. Miss Bradfield planted a tree fern. Read the details here: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16810581

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Thanks for the info, BobMeade. We have other similar photos of the tree planting ceremony here and here and here. AB

comment._content: Thanks for the links to those other photos.  The one with Dr. Bradfield in the centre is particularly good, even though he is not looking at the camera.
